p: Climate justice can be considered on global and local scale: on a global scale, for example, by demanding the discontinued use of fossil fuel and transferring funding from north to south for payment of ecological debt based on historical responsibility [104]; on a local scale, by designing public health policies and interventions to enhance the resilience of the most disadvantaged populations to climate change and its consequences [105]. One example would be to increase the urban green space in the most disadvantaged neighbourhoods, but co-designing, from the outset, measures to avoid green gentrification.
